result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:26 AM Defendant Jay Wesley Stahman in court, in custody.  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Defendant states eligible for SPD; waiting for appointment of counsel. Court sets Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

12:58 PM Defendant Jay Wesley Stahman in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde. Not eligible for SPD; Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jay Wesley Stahman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $3000 CASH bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Review hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
